comment._content: I think this is actually Henry Clews III who is mentioned as returning from school in France in 1911 in this New York Times article: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C05E5DB1438E033A... His grandfather, the financier Henry Clews, Sr gives this marvelous statement, "The time is coming, when Americans will appreciate their beautiful country and not rush to Europe to be fleeced by cringing waiters. My little grandson is receiving his early education in France, but he will soon begin in his own land, and will, I hope, make a sound American citizen."

comment._content: The whole family story is really interesting. Henry Sr. was a successful financier who founded an investment company. www.spartacus.schoolnet.co.uk/USAclews.htm He wanted Henry Jr. to follow him into the business but Henry Jr. became an artist and moved to France. www.gis.net/~scatt/clews/clews_index.html and www.amb-cotedazur.com/index.php?option=com_content&vi.... He was married twice and bought a chateau near Cannes. www.chateau-lanapoule.com/index.html Henry III was Henry Jr.'s son by his first wife, Louise Morris Gebhard. Henry III turns up in the Google newspaper index for 1925 where he seems to avoid an engagement to a woman named Vera Latimer. Unfortunately all the articles are behind a paywall. After that I can't find any more mention of him.
